info.title: symovos API
info.description: This document describes all API endpoints used for symovos AMRs. 'symovo coordinator' also uses this API. If you have any questions please contactthe support.

get.summary: Get list of Station objects
get.description: Get all objects from the database and return them as list

schema.title: Response Http Get V0 Station Get

post.description: Create a new object. Returns the created object with the given ID.

schema.title: Response Http Post V0 Station Post

400.description: request contained an ID, but IDs are given by the backend

get.summary: Wait for change of Station object referenced by ID using http longpolling
get.description:
Wait until object with the given ID has changed. The changed obj is returned.
If timeout occurs None is returned.
If the object was deleted an empty dict is returned.

schema.title: Response Http Get Changes V0 Station  Id  Wait For Changes Get

404.description: Station object with this ID does not exist

410.description: Station object was deleted while waiting for a change

get.summary: Get a signle Station object by ID

schema.title: Response Http Get Single V0 Station  Id  Get

404.description: Station Object with this ID does not exist

put.summary: Update a Station object by ID
put.description: Update an object based on its ID.

schema.title: Response Http Put V0 Station  Id  Put

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a Station object by it's ID

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Wait for a change at any Station object using http longpolling
get.description: Returns HTTP-Ok if any object of this type has been changed.

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a Job object by it's ID

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Wait for a change at any Job object using http longpolling

get.summary: Get list of AGV objects

schema.title: Response Http Get V0 Amr Get

delete.summary: Remove an AMR from the fleet.

get.summary: Wait for change of AGV object referenced by ID using http longpolling
get.description:
Wait until object with the given ID has changed. The changed obj is returned.
If timeout occurs None is returned.
If the object was deleted an empty dict is returned.

404.description: AGV object with this ID does not exist

410.description: AGV object was deleted while waiting for a change

get.summary: Get a signle AGV object by ID

404.description: AGV Object with this ID does not exist

put.summary: Update a AGV object by ID
put.description: Update an object based on its ID.

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a AGV object by it's ID

get.summary: Agv Pose
get.description: Return the current pose for the AMR with the given ID.

404.description: AMR with given ID does not exist.

503.description: AMR is not ready to answer this request. Try again.

put.description: Set the current pose for the AMR with the given ID. Only one of the arguments *station_id* or *pose* must be set. If both are provided, only *station_id* will be used.

202.description: The pose of the AMR was updated.

400.description: The request body is not valid. *station_id* or *pose* must be set.

404.description: AMR with given ID does not exist.

503.description: AMR is not ready to answer this request. Try again.

get.summary: Agv Scan
get.description: Return the current laser scan for the AMR with the given ID. The scan is returned as png.

200.description: The image with the current scan is returned.

404.description: AMR with given ID does not exist.

503.description: AMR is not ready to answer this request. Try again.

get.summary: Agv Slam Station Pose
Agv Slam State
Agv Reflector Poses
Agv Path Planned
Agv Error List

put.description: Move the AMR. The request is blocking until the AMR has stopped moving.

404.description: AMR with given ID does not exist.

503.description: AMR is not ready to answer this request. Try again.

get.summary: Get list of Map objects
get.description: Get all objects from the database and return them as list

schema.title: Response Http Get V0 Map Get

post.description: Create a new object. Returns the created object with the given ID.

400.description: request contained an ID, but IDs are given by the backend

get.summary: Wait for change of Map object referenced by ID using http longpolling
get.description:
Wait until object with the given ID has changed. The changed obj is returned.
If timeout occurs None is returned.
If the object was deleted an empty dict is returned.

404.description: Map object with this ID does not exist

410.description: Map object was deleted while waiting for a change

get.summary: Get a signle Map object by ID

404.description: Map Object with this ID does not exist

put.summary: Update a Map object by ID
put.description: Update an object based on its ID.

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a Map object by it's ID

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Wait for a change at any Map object using http longpolling
get.description: Returns HTTP-Ok if any object of this type has been changed.

get.summary: Get a Map tile as png
get.description:
Get the map object base on it's id. Return a part of the map as a map tile.
Each tile has a resolution of 256x256 px.
A zoom of 0 will return the complete map resized to a 256x256 px image.

304.description: Not changed based on provided etag

404.description: Map id unknown or coordinates out of bounds

get.summary: Slam Tile
get.description:
While the robot is recording a new map, a map preview can be received using this endpoint.
A full sized image will be returned.

get.summary: Full Tile
get.description: Get the map object base on it's id. Return the full map in one big image.

304.description: Not changed based on provided etag

404.description: Map id unknown

post.description:
Get the map object based on the request id. Load the png from the request body and update the image data.
object.

get.summary: Get list of Transport objects
get.description: Get all objects from the database and return them as list

schema.title: Response Http Get V0 Transport Get

post.description: Creates a new Transport. Created transports are automatically assigned to a suitable AMR based on matching needed_agv_attributes. If agv attribute is set during creation, only this AMR will execute the transport. The *steps* attribute contains all actions of this transport. *steps* is the only required attribute. For better readability it is recommended to add the *description* attribute.

400.description: request contained an ID, but IDs are given by the backend

get.summary: Wait for change of Transport object referenced by ID using http longpolling
get.description:
Wait until object with the given ID has changed. The changed obj is returned.
If timeout occurs None is returned.
If the object was deleted an empty dict is returned.

404.description: Transport object with this ID does not exist

410.description: Transport object was deleted while waiting for a change

get.summary: Get a signle Transport object by ID

404.description: Transport Object with this ID does not exist

put.summary: Update a Transport object by ID
put.description: Update an object based on its ID.

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a Transport object by it's ID

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Wait for a change at any Transport object using http longpolling
get.description: Returns HTTP-Ok if any object of this type has been changed.

put.summary: Create a new transport based on this job_template.

400.description: The JobTemplate is not valid, check the returned details.

404.description: JobTemplate object with this ID does not exist

put.summary: Press an IoTDevice and start a Transport
put.description:
Due to some limitations of IoT-Devices HTTP OK (200) is returned and not HTTP created (201) even though
transport was created.

schema.title: Response Press V0 Iot  Id Or Name  Press Put

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

put.summary: Trigger an IoTDevice using it's ID or Name.
put.description: If this device is connected to a Job, a new transport will be created.

400.description: ID in URL and payload do not match

404.description: Object with given ID does not exist

put.summary: Change the output state (high/low) of an IoT output
put.description: Change the IO state of an output pin of an IoT Device. The IoT Device is selected by its ID or Name

400.description: Changing output state of this IoT-Device is not supported

404.description: IoT-Device with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Get the output state (high/low) of an IoT output
get.description: Get the IO state of an output pin of an IoT Device. The IoT Device is selected by its ID or Name

400.description: Getting output state of this IoT-Device is not supported

404.description: IoT-Device with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Get the input state (high/low) of an IoT input
get.description: Get the IO state of an input pin of an IoT Device. The IoT Device is selected by its ID or Name

400.description: Getting intput state of this IoT-Device is not supported

404.description: IoT-Device with given ID does not exist

get.summary: Get the state of all inputs and outputs (high/low) of an IoT input
get.description: This is currently only supported for Flexlog devices

schema.title: Response Get State V0 Iot  Id Or Name  State Get

400.description: Getting state of this IoT-Device is not supported

404.description: IoT-Device with given ID does not exist

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the AMR, normally the hostname of the device is used.

state.title: State
state.description: Sate of the AMR, normally it's set to 'localization'.

battery_level.title: Battery Level
battery_level.description: Battery of AMR ranging from 0.0 to 1.0

AGV-Input.title: AGV
AGV-Input.description:
An AGV or AMR is a mobile robot transporting boxes from one station to another. This class shows the current state
of the mobile robot.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the AMR, normally the hostname of the device is used.

state.title: State
state.description: Sate of the AMR, normally it's set to 'localization'.

battery_level.title: Battery Level
battery_level.description: Battery of AMR ranging from 0.0 to 1.0

id.title: Id
id.description: unique identifier for this object, as string using 32 chars

AGV-Output.title: AGV
AGV-Output.description:
An AGV or AMR is a mobile robot transporting boxes from one station to another. This class shows the current state
of the mobile robot.

safety_relais_closed_state.title: Safety Relais Closed State
safety_relais_closed_state.description: True if safety relays are closed.

safety_relais_reset_request.title: Safety Relais Reset Request
safety_relais_reset_request.description: True a safety reset is needed.

drive_ready.title: Drive Ready
drive_ready.description: True if drive mode is set and motors are enabled and ready to drive

drive_manual.title: Drive Manual
drive_manual.description: True manual/push mode was enabled. Needs to be disabled before drive_mode can be set.

shutdown_request.title: Shutdown Request
shutdown_request.description: set to True right before shutdown

ina_init_error.title: Ina Init Error
ina_init_error.description: True if ina could not be initialized.

bno_init_error.title: Bno Init Error
bno_init_error.description: True if imu (bno) could not be initialized.

tmc_initialized.title: Tmc Initialized
tmc_initialized.description: False if motor controller could not be initialized.

sfuse_blown.title: Sfuse Blown
sfuse_blown.description: True if a high motor current was detected. Can be reset via REST-API call.

odom_timeout.title: Odom Timeout
odom_timeout.description: True if odometry data is not received in time.

imu_timeout.title: Imu Timeout
imu_timeout.description: True if imu data is not received in time.

imu_odom_discrepancy.title: Imu Odom Discrepancy
imu_odom_discrepancy.description: True if imu and odom data do not match, will be reset automatically when data is back to normal.

robot_paused.title: Robot Paused
robot_paused.description: True if robot is paused. Can be changed via REST-API call.

laser_timeout.title: Laser Timeout
laser_timeout.description: True if laser scanner data is not received in time.

backend_error.title: Backend Error
backend_error.description: True if backend data is not received in time.

charging_connector.title: Charging Connector
charging_connector.description: True if charger is plugged in. If set, AMR cannot move or execute transports

scanner_on.title: Scanner On
scanner_on.description: True safety scanner is turned on

emergency_stop_reset_request.title: Emergency Stop Reset Request
emergency_stop_reset_request.description: True after the e-stop was pressed. Needs to be reset by a button press.

scanner_warning_field.title: Scanner Warning Field
scanner_warning_field.description: True if some object is violating the warning field of the safety scanner.

tmc_motor_enable_error.title: Tmc Motor Enable Error
tmc_motor_enable_error.description: True motor controler could not be initialized.

waiting_for_scanner.title: Waiting For Scanner
waiting_for_scanner.description: True while safety scanner is booting.

scanner_field_b.title: Scanner Field B
scanner_field_b.description: True if safety field for card are enabled. Normally false.

backpack_lock_front.title: Backpack Lock Front
backpack_lock_front.description: True when front backpack lock is up.

backpack_lock_back.title: Backpack Lock Back
backpack_lock_back.description: True when back backpack lock is up.

backpack_box_front.title: Backpack Box Front
backpack_box_front.description: True when a box is on the front of the backpack

backpack_box_back.title: Backpack Box Back
backpack_box_back.description: True when a box is on the back of the backpack

safety_relais_closed_state.title: Safety Relais Closed State
safety_relais_closed_state.description: True if safety relays are closed.

safety_relais_reset_request.title: Safety Relais Reset Request
safety_relais_reset_request.description: True a safety reset is needed.

drive_manual.description: True manual/push mode was enabled. Needs to be disabled before drive_mode can be set.

shutdown_request.description: set to True right before shutdown

ina_init_error.description: True if ina could not be initialized.

bno_init_error.description: True if imu (bno) could not be initialized.

tmc_initialized.description: False if motor controller could not be initialized.

sfuse_blown.description: True if a high motor current was detected. Can be reset via REST-API call.

odom_timeout.description: True if odometry data is not received in time.

imu_odom_discrepancy.description: True if imu and odom data do not match, will be reset automatically when data is back to normal.

robot_paused.description: True if robot is paused. Can be changed via REST-API call.

description.title: Description
description.description: Free text for making some notes

parking_allowed.title: Parking Allowed
parking_allowed.description: When True, this station is used for parking when there is no transport available

agv.description: Reference to agv currently in this station

pos_tolerance.title: Pos Tolerance
pos_tolerance.description: Only used for WaitingStations. When set and the destination is blocked by an obstacle a nearby position is chosen.

iot_device.description: Reference to IoT device associated with thisstation.

user_offset.title: User Offset
user_offset.description: Distance between point rotation and Station

id.title: Id
id.description: unique identifier for this object, as string using 32 chars

BarMarkerStation.title: BarMarkerStation
BarMarkerStation.description:
A box station with room for 60x40 box. It's using a straight line on the side of the station for fine navigation.
This kine of Station is used for Hannover Fair and is one of the station types supported by MIR and Omron.

description.title: Description

BilateralBoxStation6x4.title: BilateralBoxStation6x4
BilateralBoxStation6x4.description:
A box station with room for 60x40 box. It can be entered from both sides of the station. The first entry is from the
front the second from the back.

ExchangeBoxStation6x4.title: ExchangeBoxStation6x4
ExchangeBoxStation6x4.description:
A Box station  with room for 60x40 box with multiple entries. It provides synchronization methods for two AMRs doing
a box exchange together. One AMR picks up the current box, immediately afterwards another amr places a new box.

HardwareAttributesModel.title: HardwareAttributesModel
HardwareAttributesModel.description:
Wraps the HardwareAttributes as a pydantic model. Use this when annotating Models.
Use HardwareAttributes in any code which works with those Models.

IoTDevice-Input.title: IoTDevice
IoTDevice-Input.description:
An IoTDevice is a small piece of Hardware having inputs and outputs. An AMR can connect via WiFi or LTE to it and
change the outputs or wait for inputs during executing a Transport. Some IoTDevices can send a HTTP-Request when an
input has changed. This is used to start a Job.

input has changed. This is used to start a Job.

continuous_loop.title: Continuous Loop
continuous_loop.description: When set to True, a transport is automatically created instead of looking for a parking space. If multiple Jobs have continuous_loop set, its randomly chosen which job to pick

Job-Input.title: Job
Job-Input.description:
A Job defines what an AMR/AGV should do. It consists of several steps. Steps will be executed one after another.
A Job can be started via the Coordinator APP or using a REST-API-Call. When starting a Job, the steps are copied
into a new Transport. The Transport is then queued for execution.

continuous_loop.title: Continuous Loop
continuous_loop.description: When set to True, a transport is automatically created instead of looking for a parking space. If multiple Jobs have continuous_loop set, its randomly chosen which job to pick

agv.description: Reference to agv assigend to this transport

job.description: The job used for creating this transport. Is set to None for automatic Transports (charging, parking) or if this transport was created directly using the REST-API.

steps.description: Steps defining what to do in this transport

state_log.title: State Log
state_log.description: This list contains all state changes and errors occurred during executing this transport. If *level* is null and *status_code* is 1 the *status_detail* defines the current Transport state (see Transport.state for details)

description.title: Description
description.description: Used for display a 'Name' for this Transport. Mainly used when job reference is not set.

cancelable.title: Cancelable
cancelable.description: When set to True this transport will be automatically canceled when another transport is started. Used for parking and charging transports.

Transport-Input.title: Transport
Transport-Input.description:
A Transport defines what the AMR is currently during or has done. It is defined by *steps*. When a Transport is
created using a Job, the job reference is set. If *job* is not set, this Transport has been created automatically
(for e.g. charging, parking) or via the REST-API.
The State-Log contains the history of this Transport. It contains the changes in the Transport's state (STARTING,
RUNNING, FINISHED) as well as all errors that have been occurred during execution (e.g. Emergency-Stop was pressed,
Navigation-Error because the path has been blocked).

agv.description: Reference to agv assigend to this transport

job.description: The job used for creating this transport. Is set to None for automatic Transports (charging, parking) or if this transport was created directly using the REST-API.

steps.description: Steps defining what to do in this transport

state_log.title: State Log
state_log.description: This list contains all state changes and errors occurred during executing this transport. If *level* is null and *status_code* is 1 the *status_detail* defines the current Transport state (see Transport.state for details)

description.title: Description
description.description: Used for display a 'Name' for this Transport. Mainly used when job reference is not set.

cancelable.title: Cancelable
cancelable.description: When set to True this transport will be automatically canceled when another transport is started. Used for parking and charging transports.

id.title: Id
id.description: unique identifier for this object, as string using 32 chars

state.description:
Current transport state. Options: 0: UNKNOWN
1: UNASSIGNED
2: ASSIGNED
3: RECEIVED
4: STARTING
5: RUNNING
9: CANCELING
6: CANCELED
7: ERROR
8: FINISHED

Transport-Output.title: Transport
Transport-Output.description:
A Transport defines what the AMR is currently during or has done. It is defined by *steps*. When a Transport is
created using a Job, the job reference is set. If *job* is not set, this Transport has been created automatically
(for e.g. charging, parking) or via the REST-API.
The State-Log contains the history of this Transport. It contains the changes in the Transport's state (STARTING,
RUNNING, FINISHED) as well as all errors that have been occurred during execution (e.g. Emergency-Stop was pressed,
Navigation-Error because the path has been blocked).

step_idx.title: Step Idx
step_idx.description: Step idx which this event belongs to. Starting at 0 for the first step.

status_code.description:
Error/State code from TransportErrorCodes. Options:
0: INTERNAL_JOB_STATUS
1: NO_ERROR
2: SHUTDOWN
3: DUMMY
1000: SCANNER_INTERNAL_ERROR
1001: SCANNER_UNKNOWN_ERROR
1002: SCANNER_NOT_RESPONDING
1003: SCANNER_OPTICAL_WINDOW
1004: SCANNER_EDM_ERROR
1005: SCANNER_DATA_TIMEOUT
1010: SCANNER_OBSTACLE
2000: SFUSE_BLOWN
2001: EMERGENCY_STOP
2002: EMERGENCY_STOP_RESET
2003: EMERGENCY_WAITING_FOR_SCANNER
2004: MANUAL_MODE_SET
3001: REFLECTOR_NAVIGATION_ERROR_ENTER
3002: REFLECTOR_NAVIGATION_ERROR_LEAVE
3003: REFLECTOR_NAVIGATION_STATION_ERROR
3004: REFLECTOR_NAVIGATION_ERROR_ENTER_START_OVER
3005: REFLECTOR_NAVIGATION_ERROR_LEAVE_START_OVER
4000: BACKPACK_LOCK_ERROR
4001: BACKPACK_CAN_WRITE
4002: BACKPACK_CAN_READ
4003: BACKPACK_CAN_READ_VALUE
5000: STATION_STATE_ERROR
5001: STATION_STATE_ERROR_BOX
5002: STATION_STATE_ERROR_NO_BOX
5003: BACKPACK_STATE_ERROR_BOX
5004: BACKPACK_STATE_ERROR_NO_BOX
5005: CART_SAFETY_AREA_ERROR
6000: NAV_GLOBAL_PLANNER_ERROR
6001: NAV_LOCAL_PLANNER_ERROR
6002: NAV_ERROR
7000: ODOM_TIMEOUT_ERROR
7001: IMU_TIMEOUT_ERROR
7002: ODOM_IMU_DEVIATION_ERROR
7003: ROBOT_PAUSED
7004: CHARGER_CONNECTED
7005: ROADMAP_STOP
7006: MAIN_PCB_TIMEOUT
7007: SMOOTHER_TIMEOUT
8001: BACKEND_JOBSTEP_ERROR
8002: PYTHON_JOBSTEP_ERROR
8003: FIRE_ALARM_ERROR
9999: UNKNOWN_ERROR

status_detail.title: Status Detail
status_detail.description: For some errors there a internal error details codes

level.title: Level
level.description:
severity level of this event. Options:
20: INFO
30: WARNING
40: ERROR
null: used for state change

step_idx.title: Step Idx
step_idx.description: Step idx which this event belongs to. Starting at 0 for the first step.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of this zone, can be chosen freely

type.description:
Defines the type of this zone. Options: 0: UNKNOWN
1: DRIVEWAY
2: INTERSECTION
3: RESTRICTED
4: SPEED_ONLY
5: ACTION
6: FIRE

points.title: Points
points.description: Points defining the polygon of this zone

maxSpeed.title: Maxspeed
maxSpeed.description: If set > 0 the maximum driving speed is limited to this value

danger_area.title: Danger Area
danger_area.description: if set, turns on a amr warning light while the amr is inside of this zone

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: If set to False zone is ignored in all logic

agvs.description: A list of all AMRs inside of this zone

max_amr_count.title: Max Amr Count
max_amr_count.description: The maximum number of AMRs this zone can have. If this limit is reached further AMRs will stop a the edge of this zone until another AMR has made space in the zone by leaving it. Setting this to None/null allows unlimited AMRs

iot.description: Reference to the iot-device of this zone. Only used for ACTION zones

tags.name: Station
tags.description:
A Station is a place where you can put boxes, place carts or just a point where the AMR can stop while executing
a Transport.

tags.name: Job
tags.description:
A Job defines what an AMR/AGV should do. It consists of several steps. Steps will be executed one after another.
A Job can be started via the Coordinator APP or using a REST-API-Call. When starting a Job, the steps are copied
into a new Transport. The Transport is then queued for execution.

tags.name: Zone
tags.description: A Zone is an area in a Map. The *type* defines its functionality.

tags.name: Landmark
tags.description: Landmarks are used to improve the localization of an AMR. They are only needed in very dynamic environments.

tags.name: AGV
tags.description:
An AGV or AMR is a mobile robot transporting boxes from one station to another. This class shows the current state
of the mobile robot.

tags.name: Map
tags.description: A Map contains the factory layout. It is recorded by an AMR during the initial setup.

tags.name: Transport
tags.description:
A Transport defines what the AMR is currently during or has done. It is defined by *steps*. When a Transport is
created using a Job, the job reference is set. If *job* is not set, this Transport has been created automatically
(for e.g. charging, parking) or via the REST-API.
The State-Log contains the history of this Transport. It contains the changes in the Transport's state (STARTING,
RUNNING, FINISHED) as well as all errors that have been occurred during execution (e.g. Emergency-Stop was pressed,
Navigation-Error because the path has been blocked).

tags.name: IoTDevice
tags.description:
An IoTDevice is a small piece of Hardware having inputs and outputs. An AMR can connect via WiFi or LTE to it and
change the outputs or wait for inputs during executing a Transport. Some IoTDevices can send a HTTP-Request when an
input has changed. This is used to start a Job.
